p: Statute for Members of the European Parliament
Implementing measures for the Statute for Members of the European Parliament
p lang: and in particular Articles 10 to 21 and 24 thereof.

p: This appropriation is intended to cover reimbursement of travel and subsistence expenses in connection with travelling to and from the places of work and with other duty travel.
Part of this appropriation is intended to take into account reductions in travel expenses as a result of the European Parliament’s resolution of 10 May 2011 (OJ L 250
column14: p. 3) to use accumulated air miles

p: The amount of assigned revenue in accordance with Article 21(3) of the Financial Regulation is estimated at EUR 10 000.
This appropriation is intended to cover the effects of any adjustments to payments to Members of the institution.
It is purely provisional and may be used only after its transfer to other headings in accordance with the Financial Regulation.
This appropriation is intended to cover the purchase
column14: use and repair of vehicles (fleet of cars and bicycles) and the hire of cars
column18: including the necessary insurance cover and other management costs. When replacing the car fleet or purchasing or hiring vehicles
column19: preference will be given to cars that are the least polluting for the environment

p: The amount of assigned revenue in accordance with Article 21(3) of the Financial Regulation is estimated at EUR 175 000.
This appropriation is intended to cover the purchase of paper
column15: supplies for the print shop and document reproduction workshops
column17: together with the related management costs.

p: The amount of assigned revenue in accordance with Article 21(3) of the Financial Regulation is estimated at EUR 15 000.

nmc-expenditure: This appropriation is intended to cover the cost of removal and handling work carried out by removal firms or by temporary handling staff supplied by outside agencies.

p: The amount of assigned revenue in accordance with Article 21(3) of the Financial Regulation is estimated at EUR 40 000.
